metadata.title: CVE-2020-12401 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
During ECDSA signature generation, padding applied in the nonce designed toensure constant-time scalar multiplication was removed, resulting invariable-time execution dependent on secret data. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 80 and Firefox for Android < 80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.4
libnss3-tools - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.4').
firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
